answers.answer: HiThanks for writing to the forum!Sinusitis involving the frontal and maxillary sinus can cause facial swelling that goes down with antibiotics. You need to get the X-rays of the sinuses along with probably a CT scan. If the sinuses are really filled with a lot of fluid, it would need to be drained.The swelling could also be due to water retention as in low protein in blood, kidney problems, severe anemia etc. There are chances that you have a kidney problem too—say an infection that responds to antibiotics. A kidney function test and a urine examination is a must.It could be due to hypothyroidism too (however you have had several tests). An autoimmune thyroid disease can be detected by doing a microsomal antibody tests. Diabetes Mellitus too can cause similar symptoms.The diagnosis and further tests will depend on whether the swelling is a pitting edema (causes a dent on pressure) or a non pitting edema.Hope this helps. Please let me know if there is any thing else and do keep me posted. Take care!

question: Within the last 2 years I have had the left side of my face to swell some.  Facial appearance has changed; from behind my left ear all the way down to my thyroid in my neck.  These are/are not the symptoms:Edema presentTenderness, yet no pain around thyroidExcessive weight gainFatigueEdema goes down with antibiotics from sinus & eye infections but comes right backSuspect hormone imbalance since miscarriages in 1997 & 1999When I first recognized these symptoms I went to a GP who ordered blood work for thyroid testing.  Test results came back normal.  DON'T KNOW HOW MANY WERE RAN!!!  T3,T4,CBC, & CAT SCAN.   ENT told me no concern about thyroids and prescribed sinus medicine & antibiotic.  This was probably in 2004.  I quit going to him and went to a better ENT because I started having other problems related to sinus infections.  I HAVE BEEN DIAGNOSED WITH MENEIRE'S DISEASE (Inner Ear Imbalance Disorder) but I still have the above too!!!QUESTION:  SHOULD I HAVE THYROID CHECKED AGAIN BECAUSE MY GUT TELLS ME I HAVE THISPROBLEM AND SOMETHING IS BEING OVERLOOKED?  ARE BOTH PROBLEMS RELATED?(meaning a secondary cause)
title: DX---Meniere's; suspect THYROID PROBLEMS
